entries.meaning: (dated) The smallest of regular sizes of portrait photographs.
examples: The title page bears a minette portrait of the Duke being crowned by the hand of an ideal figure of Chicago, and below are the coat-of-arms and motto of the Duke's house.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A mineral deposit consisting of iron ore of sedimentary origin, found in the south of Luxembourg and in Lorraine.
examples: The minettes of Buell Mountain are felsic, and many contain ground-mass quartz.
